text: rden-Walker syndrome? Marden-Walker syndrome is characterized by a mask-like face with blepharophimosis (a narrowing of the eye opening), small mouth, micrognathia, cleft or high-arched palate, low-set ears, multiple congenital joint contractures (chronic shortening of muscles or tendons around joints), and decreased muscular mass. Additional features may include ptosis, arachnodactyly, camptodactyly (an unusual curvature of the fingers), chest deformities, kyphoscoliosis, and absent deep tendon
